title: How to Make Duct Tape Hair Bows

steps.headline: With your 10 inch piece of duct-tape, fold it over, and leave about 1 centimeter of stickiness showing.
Fold it into a circle, using the sticky part to hold the circle.
Going to the middle, use your index finger and thumb to pinch down the sides, making the formation of a bow.
Now, with your other colored piece of tape, wrap it around the pinched-down part to stick it.
You now have a bow.

text: Steps With your 10 inch piece of duct-tape, fold it over, and leave about 1 centimeter of stickiness showing.  Fold it into a circle, using the sticky part to hold the circle. Flatten it out. Going to the middle, use your index finger and thumb to pinch down the sides, making the formation of a bow.  Now, with your other colored piece of tape, wrap it around the pinched-down part to stick it.  You now have a bow. Glue this to a clip, so you can show it off! See video for more detail!  Method 2 Cut a 6" duct tape strip.  Fold it in half, being careful to match up the edges.  Accordion fold the strip lengthwise until you cannot fold it any more.  Cut off any excess duct tape.  Cut a 1 cm strip and wrap it around the middle lengthwise.  Slip a bobby pin under the skinny strip in a crease.  Wear it with style!
